title: spack initial compiler detection issue at NAS
body:
All,

I recently decided to try using Spack to maintain my own packages/modules out at NAS, NASA's supercomputing site at Ames (note: expect many a bugfix for tcsh shell integration). However, the simple "git clone; spack install libelf" that is the "Hello World" of Spack fails:

```
(3) $ spack install libelf 
==> Installing libelf
==> Fetching http://www.mr511.de/software/libelf-0.8.13.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /nobackupp9/gmao_SIteam/spack/var/spack/stage/libelf-0.8.13-iotm5hoaoi7bqgidhelltsr3we6si5y6/libelf-0.8.13.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /nobackupp9/gmao_SIteam/spack/var/spack/stage/libelf-0.8.13-iotm5hoaoi7bqgidhelltsr3we6si5y6
==> Ran patch() for libelf
==> Building libelf [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase : 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase : 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/nobackupp9/gmao_SIteam/spack/var/spack/stage/libelf-0.8.13-iotm5hoaoi7bqgidhelltsr3we6si5y6/libelf-0.8.13/configure' '--prefix=/nobackupp9/gmao_SIteam/spack/opt/spack/linux-sles11-x86_64/gcc-4.3.4/libelf-0.8.13-iotm5hoaoi7bqgidhelltsr3we6si5y6' '--enable-shared' '--disable-dependency-tracking' '--disable-debug'
/nobackupp9/gmao_SIteam/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/autotools.py:268, in configure:
     261      def configure(self, spec, prefix):
     262          """Runs configure with the arguments specified in :py:meth:`.configure_args`
     263          and an appropriately set prefix.
     264          """
     265          options = ['--prefix={0}'.format(prefix)] + self.configure_args()
     266  
     267          with working_dir(self.build_directory, create=True):
  >> 268              inspect.getmodule(self).configure(*options)

See build log for details:
  /nobackupp9/mathomp4/scratch/spack-stage/spack-stage-xygf38/libelf-0.8.13/spack-build.out
```
I did a bit of sleuthing around and I think the reason it fails is because of the compilers.yaml that spack autogenerated:
```
(4) $ cat ~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: sles11
    paths:
      cc: null
      cxx: null
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran-4.3
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran-4.3
    spec: gcc@4.3.4
    target: x86_64
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: sles11
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: null
      fc: null
    spec: gcc@4.3
    target: x86_64
```
When it tried to build libelf, it chose to use gcc@4.3.0 which, indeed, does not have a very useful C compiler "null". So, I'm guessing I could easily fix this by hand-editing this file to combine the two compilers into one. I'm more concerned about why Spack did this in the first place. Any ideas?

Matt
